column2: # Here we plot the socio-demographic variables on a map

map_income <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("household_median_income_2011", tm_scale_continuous(values="Purples"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2, legend.reverse = TRUE)

#map_education <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("household_qualifications_2011", tm_scale_continuous(values="Greens"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2)

map_BAME <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("BAME_2011_perc", tm_scale_continuous(values="Purples"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2, legend.reverse=TRUE)

#map_foodpt <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("food_pt", tm_scale_continuous(values="Greens"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2)

map_foodwalk <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("food_walk", tm_scale_continuous(values="Purples"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2, legend.reverse=TRUE)

map_carownership <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("households_with_cars", tm_scale_continuous(values="Purples"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2, legend.reverse=TRUE)

map_age <- tm_shape(na.omit(london_data)) + tm_polygons("avg_age", tm_scale_continuous(values="Purples"), col_alpha = 0, tm_legend(title="", frame=FALSE)) + tm_layout(frame=FALSE, legend.text.size=1.2, legend.reverse = TRUE)
